ingredients.content: 50 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (2 cm)
20 g vegetable oil, plus extra for greasing

preparations.content: Grease 6 Thermomix ramekins size 1 and place 1 sage leaf in the base of each.
Place hazelnuts in mixing bowl and chop <b>6 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place Parmesan and 3 sage leaves in mixing bowl then grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer to another bowl and set aside.
Place garlic, onions and oil in mixing bowl then chop <b>3 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>5 min/120°C/speed 1<b>. Transfer to a third bowl and set aside.
Place ricotta, reserved Parmesan mixture, egg, salt and pepper in mixing bowl then mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>.

Add reserved onion mixture and stir <b>10 sec//speed 2<b>. Finish stirring by hand with spatula if necessary. Divide mixture between prepared ramekins and sprinkle over reserved chopped hazelnuts. Cover each ramekin with heat-resistant cling film and place in Varoma dish. Clean mixing bowl.

Place water in mixing bowl, place covered Varoma into position and steam <b>30 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Remove Varoma, carefully remove Varoma lid and leave cakes to cool for approx. 10 minutes. Carefully remove cling film, unmould cakes with a table knife and serve each with 1 tsp cranberry compote.
